html:
Alternative forms[edit]

  • conputō

Etymology[edit]

From con- +‎ putō (“reckon”).

Pronunciation[edit]

  • (Classical) IPA(key): /ˈkom.pu.toː/, [ˈkɔm.pʊ.t̪oː]
  • (Ecclesiastical) IPA(key): /ˈkom.pu.to/, [ˈkɔm.pu.t̪ɔ]

Verb[edit]

computō (present infinitive computāre, perfect active computāvī, supine computātum); first conjugation

  1. I calculate, compute, reckon together

Conjugation[edit]

Derived terms[edit]

  • computus

Descendants[edit]

  • Aragonese: contar
  • Asturian: contar; → computar
  • Catalan: comptar, contar; → computar
  • Corsican: cuntà; → computà, cumputà
  • Extremaduran: contal
  • Franco-Provençal: contar, comptar; → computar
  • Old French: conter
    • French: conter, compter
      • → English: count, compt
      • → Romanian: conta (or through Italian)
    • Walloon: conter
  • → French: computer
    • English: compute
  • Friulian: contâ
  • Galician: contar, → Galician: computar
  • Gallurese: cuntà
  • Italian: contare
    • → Romanian: conta (or through French)
  • Italian: compitare
  • → Italian: computare
  • Leonese: contare
  • Ligurian: contâ
  • Middle French: compter
  • Mirandese: cuntar
  • Neapolitan: cuntà
  • Occitan: comptar, contar, compdar, condar
  • Old Occitan: contar, comptar
  • Old French: conter
  • Old Portuguese: contar
  • Old Spanish: contar
  • Piedmontese: cunté; → compüté (semi-learned)
  • Portuguese: contar; → computar
  • Romanian: cumpăta; → computa
  • Romansch: chintar, quintar
  • Sassarese: cuntà
  • Sicilian: cuntari
  • Spanish: contar; → computar
  • Venetian: contar, conpedar
  • → English: computate

References[edit]

  • computo in Charlton T. Lewis and Charles Short (1879) A Latin Dictionary, Oxford: Clarendon Press
  • computo in Charlton T. Lewis (1891) An Elementary Latin Dictionary, New York: Harper & Brothers
  • computo in Gaffiot, Félix (1934) Dictionnaire Illustré Latin-Français, Hachette
  • computo in Ramminger, Johann (accessed 16 July 2016) Neulateinische Wortliste: Ein Wörterbuch des Lateinischen von Petrarca bis 1700‎[1], pre-publication website, 2005-2016
